title.narrative: Strengthening universal access to HIV /AIDS and Social Protection services to prevent and mitigate the impact of HIV and AIDS and Poverty in Sub-saharan Africa

description.narrative: Evidence based research and learning contributing to global, regional and national HIV and AIDS and social protection policies and programmes.
Increased access to HIV and social protection services through increased targeting of most disadvantaged groups by service providers.
Increased participation of Civil Socierty Organisations in the formulation and monitroing of national and regional HIV and AIDS and social protections policies and strategies.
Regional and national level HIV and ADIS and social protection plolicies, plans and budgets increasingly address the needs of vulnerable groups.

To improve universal access to HIV/AIDS services and social protection mechanisms for vulnerable groups in Sub-Saharan Africa, focusing on work with governments, service providers and civil society organsations in Ethiopia, Mozambique, Tanzania, Uganda and Zambia. Learning from the programme will be used to influence the policies, strategies and programme of global and regional bodies and donors in addition to national governments.

participating-org.narrative: Coalition on Children Affected by AIDS (CCABA)
SCAZ - Senior Citizen's Association of Zambia
